title: Noonan Syndrome
definition:
Noonan syndrome is an autosomal dominant RASopathy marked by short stature, characteristic facies, congenital heart defects, and variable developmental delay. Severity of the disorder varies and is dependent on which genes are involved. 

Most commonly, the disease affects PTPN11, SOS1, RAF1 and RIT1 and causes hyperstimulation of proteins in the RAS/MAPK pathway, stunting cell growth.
